import os
from IPython.display import display, Markdown, HTML

ticks3 = """```"""

def download_button(filename, extension):
    path = "/archive/code/"
    # icon_base = icon[:2]
    return f"""<a class="btn btn-outline-dark rounded", href="{path}{filename}.{extension}" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
        <i class="bi bi-download"></i> Download code
    </a>"""


def toggle_code_button(filename):
    return (f"""<button class="btn btn-outline-dark  rounded" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#{filename}" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="{filename}">
    <i class="bi bi-toggles"></i> Toggle code
    </button>
    """
    )

def toggle_code(filename, extension):
    # print(os.getcwd())
    path = "../../archive/code/"
    if extension == 'ino':
        highlight = 'c'
    if extension == 'py':
        highlight = 'python'
    with open(path+filename+'.'+extension, 'r') as f:
        contents = f.read()

    display(HTML(f"""
            <div class="collapse" id="{filename}">
            <div class="card card-body border-0">
        """))
    display(Markdown(ticks3 + f'{{.{highlight} code-line-numbers="1"}}\n' + 
            contents + "\n" + 
            ticks3 + "\n"))
    display(HTML("""
            </div>
            </div>
            """
        ))

def code_source(filename, extension):
    buttons = []
    buttons.append(toggle_code_button(filename))
    buttons.append(download_button(filename, extension))
    display(HTML(" ".join(buttons)))
    toggle_code(filename, extension)
